description:
Good for beginner and for the experienced rider all from thrills to drops to butter boxes, wall rides, gaps, tables and more. Also has a lot of great view sites of the Crowsnest Pass.
   - lots of new stuff each year
   - maintained 
   - good rating
   - come out in to Bellevue so you don't get lost and can treat yourself with ice cream after a long ride on main street of Bellevue.
For directions you can email me at ilovedownhilling@hotmail.com or ask someone at Stones Throw Cafe on main street Blairemore.
directions:
In the town of Frank by the Fats gas there is a road that goes up to the Frank slide interpretive center.  Turn there and go up there when the main road turns to the interpretive center. You've got to start on the gravel road and  stay on main road all the way up. When up there the road leads in to a feild stop the and you will see a quad trail go up the hill almost to the top and turn to the right and climb the little cliff and that's where it begins.
You should be able to see other tracks from bike tires. If more info needed email me at ilovedownhilling@hotmail.com
title: Good Ridance
